Reviews.Title: “Friendly and nice in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Monteironeto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and had a great time. The hotel is less than a bloco from Cardinal Lemoine metro station, very easy to reach from CDG. Rooms are small but cozy, service is very good. They have a nice library where you can brouse through and pick what you like for reading at any of the nice cafés on the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching, this place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: MrSaltwater
Reviews.Content: Sitting at Breakfast I'm pleasantly surprised at the wonderful spread of cereal, eggs, meats, yogurt, cheese, fruit salad, teas, coffee, juice, pastries and of course Baguettes! More in sync with a typical German hotel breakie. This quaint hotel in sight of the Notre Dame is a delight. The staff are very warm and welcoming - having no issue with talking your language of choice. Personally pillows are very important and I have not been disappointed. The bed is comfy too. It was nice to have a hot bath that was plenty big enough for this 100kg bloke. Open the windows and step out onto a cute little veranda with a view over the Latin Quarter and spiral of Notre Dame. This review was provided with the strong and free wifi throughout the building. Great for keeping check on business back home. So after searching the 1844 hotels available I'm very pleased with the €110 per night I have spent! I'm heading out now to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: seacatb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location only 5 mins from Notre Dame and 10 mins from the lovely Jardin Du Luxembourg. A bit expensive and the rooms were small but the air con was good. A good 2 star hotel. Staff very helpful and nice and easy going. Breakfast good. Bit noisy some nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and the location, would use again”
Reviews.Author: lostCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel is nicely located for walking around Paris centre. It has a lovely character and the staff were friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. It was small but rooms in Paris are generally small. Had a nice view of Notre Dame from our window. Breakfast was not included in our rate so I can not rate it. Would recommend and use again. There are some nice restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: RogerioF1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days with my wife and we had a terrific time. Nice rooms, cozy atmosphere, excellent breakfast for european standards. Located in a quite area very close to Blvd St Michel and in a walk distance to several touristic places in Paris. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny”
Reviews.Author: KayEmLA
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was a tiny twin room on floor 4. Although slightly cramped, the room and bathroom were clean. The wireless Internet access was quick when it worked but half of the time it didn't. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: magdzicka
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews the hotel has a tiny cramped breakfast room - just around tables for 29 rooms so it might mean you might not have your breakfat when desired but have to wait till other people are gone. Limited choice of food as well. Not the best start on anyone's day... Rooms were OK and bayhrooms clean. Staff very helpful however on one occasion on our return to the hotel the door was locked and there was nobody in reception which meant we had to wait outside - it never happened to us before. The location was great but the presence of a pub on the other side of the street and its guests did wake us up several times during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but a lot missing”
Reviews.Author: RogerThornhill
Reviews.Content: Your first impression of this hotel is that it is just plain pretty. The literary motif is beautifully done with dark wood bookshelves everywhere you look, nicely complementing the architecture of the old building. But the place has issues beyond the aesthetics. The staff, for one, is well in line with the standards of French customer service. On the day and a half that we were there it seemed like the front desk was manned by a different person every other hour. That in itself is not the problem except for the fact that each of them seemed more annoyed than the other to be there in the first place. The room was nice and clean but a bit cramped because it was obviously a double converted into a triple. But the tiny breakfast room was so crowded on the morning we were there that some people opted to eat on the staircase. And having so many people waiting around for tables made us so uncomfortable, we felt forced to rush through our small meal. The food choices were typical continental. On the day of our departure, my wife had to use the lobby bathroom, only to get locked in because the door was broken. You could say the excellent location could make up for some of the downsides but overall this was a spotty experience ... not awful but just not good enough to rate it higher than average.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quiet, convenient”
Reviews.Author: nosnerk
Reviews.Content: Caveat: I was in Paris for 2 weeks and stayed in this hotel the 2nd week after a quite shabby hotel near the Opera. I enjoyed my stay. The staff was decent. Housekeeping was efficient. The breakfast area was fine although small in choices. My room on the 2nd floor was good, the bed was very nice (maybe even new), although the ceiling in the bathroom had some peeling. They provided good soaps, shampoos, plenty of towels and the shower worked great!!! (a big improvement over previous week). Plus, the free wireless worked well with decent speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Montslondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the lovely left bank and is close to a couple of metro stations. It is down a quiet part of the Rue Des Ecoles but Odeon, Pantheon and Notre Dame are well within walking distance. It has a smart reception but the room wasn't of the same standard. It was small and the decor was clean but basic, dull and a bit tired looking. The bathroom's art deco design was cool but the shower went scoldingly hot from time to time. I expected this based on other reviews but was surprised by how hot the water got! I got this hotel at a great price so can't complain, but if I had paid full price I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and smart”
Reviews.Author: What-Katy-Did
Reviews.Content: I stayed at theis hotel for my birthday and it was very lovely! The staff knew what they were doing and it's handy for metros-Cardinal Lemoine and Jussieu stations. It's very tasteful and smokefree if you stay on one of the non-smoking floors (unusual in Paris) and the rooms are better sized than usual for it too. Even our bathroom had space to swing a cat. There was a bath and shower and one of those trendy free-standing sinks. The large windows are draped with excellent curtains and I slept well here. Although you can't go out the windows have the little balcony things that traditional Parisian buildings have. Only problem which is ok if you are prepared is that in the shower the water can switch temperatures if someone in another room uses their water. But there are lovely toiletries and everything, plenty of towels, hotel hairdryer, magnifying mirror. I would love to go back here, we paid about 115 euros per night so look around for deals like that. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “filthy, a must avoid!”
Reviews.Author: jerry2000
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel at 12:30 a.m. after a 2 hr drive from CDG. The only positive thing about this hotel was Olivier, the night clerk, who was very friendly and kind. The hotel was fully booked so I was given the worst room in the hotel, room 001 on the street level. Open the curtains and there are the parked cars and garbage bins for your viewing pleasure.You can hear everything going on in the lobby and there is a computer "room" (really a closet) just outside the door. There is a 5 ft long by 5" wide strip torn off the ceiling. The bathroom door is shiny with filth. The bathroom ceiling has blacky greasy fingerprints on it from where a repairman tried to fix the a/c and the bathtub walls have mould encrusted on them. The carpet is sticky and disgusting. I asked for a better room the next day and the day clerk pretended to search in her computer for availability and then surprise! ...no room. Upon checking out 2 days later another clerk could not even manage a smile, goodbye or simple eye contact. I think she knows she is working in a dump and is not proud of it. Spend a little more if you can and stay at the Pont Royal on 7 rue de montalambert.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: gairlochloyal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights (late Nov 06) and was suitably impressed by the hotel. The rooms aren't the biggest but are well appointed and were spotless. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom is a good size, with some nice free toiletries and a decent power shower. Breakfast was OK with pastries, bread, meats/cheese, cereal and fruit juice. Although the dinnig room is rather cramped. Reception were good and spoke excellent english. They even arranged for me to get my room early despite arriving at 10am. They simply asked if I could return back in an hour and the room would be ready (normal check in is 2pm). One negative was that the internet in the lobby was not working when I went to use it. The hotel is in an excellent location. About 3-5mins walk from Notre Damme and St Michel train station (one of the stops from Orly/CDG link). There are also 2 more Metro stations nearby. Overall the hotel was excellent value for money (esp. for a 3 star in Paris) and is in a great location for exploring Paris. There is also a wide range of eating/drinking places nearby!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevie1
Reviews.Content: possibly even nicer compared to many other in Paris but... We stayed in room 302 which was pretty small - no where to put our luggage, which is a slight problem when you come to Paris for 6 days. Rooms cleaned daily to a good standard (although some of the decor looked slightly on the tatty side for a recently renovated hotel) with a large comfortable bathroom (almost bigger than the room itself!). A bit chaotic at breakfast time - some days food wasn't replenished when ran out, tables not cleared for guests to sit at and slightly moody breakfast room attendant. Although the staff at reception desk were very helpful and kind. A free use of a PC and internet at loby which is very handy. A bit miffed that we didn't have a kettle in our room like the previous review - inconsistency? I am not that bothered but aren't all rooms the same? Great location, very easy walk to metro stations and other parts of the city, a good selection of bars, restaurants and bakeries in the area, which felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect birthday gift”
Reviews.Author: polegar
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend just HAD (doesn't matter how tacky can this sound) to go to Paris for my birthday. we're portuguese, so unfortunately our salaries aren't comparable to frech lifestyle. anyway, we decided to go crazy and booked with our internet travel agent one of the cheaper (not cheap) packages available (flight, hotel and breakfast). we asked around to a friend who lives there and we had some guarantees about the place. but we could never guess... we got there and the urban myth about french bad manners just evaporated with the first welcome smile. they sent us to the 6th floor and - oh God - it was the top floor. an amazing view and the sweetest room, perfectly clean, beautifully decorated, great bathroom, the sweetest staff, the bonus of having an electric pot to make tea at night, good continental breakfast... in a great location: very quiet at night but 5 minutes walking from the Seine, from Notre Dame, from the bars, from the subway... and it's so romantic to light up a cigarette in the tiny balcony and just stay there watching the stars over the Paris roof tops... (sigh) We had the birthday gift of our lives. we miss it badly. if we get to go there again, we will HAVE to go to this specific hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough Stay”
Reviews.Author: PointeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after I saw the writeup in Fodor's 2006. The location is decent (we love the Latin Quarter) and the room was spacious (#301). The guy at the desk was so helpful--he went above and beyond courteous. The breakfast was nice, and you can even get it delivered to your room, no extra charge. The downside--noisy in the middle of the night as people returned to their rooms, and our floor smelled smoky. However, they gave us that floor because it had the biggest room, so I can't complain. Shower had some sort of glass partition that didn't cover the tub all the way, so floor was soaked. Overall, it was OK, but I was glad we were there for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARUANO
Reviews.Content: The Quartier Latin (it is not part of Libertel anymore) is a great choice if you want to stay at the Latin Quartier (even not in the middle of it). The rooms (as most in Paris) are small, but with a lot of light and nice decoration (see photos). The lobby is great and the breakfast varied enough and filling. The staff was great with us and, even we had minor problems (towels just for one person on the second day or no kettle and cups in one of the rooms), they were fast to solve them with an excuse. The free wifi internet is a plus. It is 5 minutes walk from Notre Dame (and the RER to both Paris airports) and 10 min. from the Marais and all the buzz if you don´t feel like staying in the nights at the LQ. You have a tube station (Cardenal Lemoine) just 50 m. away. They have their own website know (hotelquartierlatin.(-))

Reviews.Title: “Room without ventilation or Air Con & rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 2 night stay and were given a room on the ground floor with plate glass windows that could not open. As the month had just changed to October the hotel had switched off the air conditioning. We complained immediately as the room was horribly stuffy and stale, but the hotel was fully booked. We had a very airless and uncomfortable night. Whilst we were offered another room for our 2nd night, the hotel offered no compensation and the staff were very aloof and rude when we politely suggested that some compensation would be appropriate. As we booked through an agency (Holidaybound Ltd. Paris Charming Hotels) we were told by staff that they could not do anything. We have taken the matter up with the agency and shall update our review with the outcome. The hotel was fine in other regards and this was a classic example of treating guests with cynicism and disregard. We also observed staff ridiculing other guests in a very off-hand and disconcerting manner.

Reviews.Title: “A proper professional hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Libertel Quartier Latin Hotel for 3 nights in July 2005, an air conditioned room number 505 with two separated comfortable beds with roomy bathroom and a tiny balcony to Rue des Ecoles. I suppose that the room, maybe the whole hotel in its entirety was recently renewed, and it was a positive surprise to me. I have to say that I have met lot of disappointments in the ***hotels in Paris. The location is safe and excellent to walk around, to the museums (Cluny, Patheon, Notre Dame, Louvre, Orsay), to the shopping areas (affordable for ordinary people) and the interesting old narrow streets with lot of small galleries, bookshops, small boutiques, restaurants, jazz clubs etc. You can easily take the RER-train, metro or bus, the stations and bus lines are just around the corner. We were satisfied with the room, although it was rather small than spacious and it was quite expensive, too (about 140-160 euros per night for two persons, our travel was a package by a net travel agency). I have to say that I have had often disappointing experience with ***hotels in Paris. The room was very clean. If you are afraid of the noise in the street, keep the windows tightly closed to keep it off. There is a minibar and tv. The breakfast was better than I expected, with fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, müsli and cornflakes, scrambled eggs, some mornings boiled eggs too, ham, two types of bread, small croissants, jam, fruits. Some English and French newspapers were availably daily. The attitude of the staff was helpful and friendly. There in the room were available nice teacups, coffee and tea bags with bisquits There was not a water cooker in the room but after asking we could borrow it. Especially I liked the friendly and peaceful athmosphere in the breakfast room. It is indeed in the dark basement but still OK. I will choose Libertel Quartier Latin Hotel next time too. However, I do prefer an “own” apartment in an old parisien house if I stay with a friend for a week or longer period. It is nice to have a comfortable, spacious flat of two rooms with kitchen, and for two or a bigger group it is cheaper than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Louclogs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel and having booked it and then read the reviews on this site were very nervous about staying there. We should have spent the time looking forward to our break not worrying if we had made a mistake - the hotel was lovely. We had booked a room for two adults and a child. Our room was right at the top (one sofa bed - double - and a double made from two singles). The room included a tv, minibar plus writing desk, mini safe, etc. The best features were (i) two little balconies overlooking the street - one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom - great to stand out on and watch the world go by (ii) a huge lovely bathroom - though there was the challenge of French plumbing - but this added to the charm! The room was clean and nicely decorated in a typical Parisian style. The first day the room was not made up - but putting the make up our room notice sorting this out each day seemed to resolve this. Breakfast was served everyday and included a good selection of cereals, fruit juices, pastries, yogurts, breads, cold meats and eggs (scrambled and boiled) and as much coffee as you wanted. Staff were friendly and courteous. We were able to leave bags at the hotel on our day of depature, and they didn't mind us returning half way through the day to rescue waterproofs etc. and wander off again. The area was fantastic - great places to eat on the doorstep, very close to metro, a five min walk to Notre Dame and the waterbus stop. We easily walked to the Louvre from the hotel. Based on experiences of comparable three star hotels in paris - this is one we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during one of our trips to Paris in late August 2004. As we are holders of the Accor Hotels Favorite Guest card and this hotel is a member of the Accor family, we thought it will be a nice choice, conveniently located. The hotel is located in the Latin quarter, close to the Cardinal Lemoine metro station. This is an old building with tiny rooms. We had a reservation for a smoking room but when we arrived, there was no smoking rooms left, we were assigned a room for non-smokers. The room they gave us turned out to be occupied by other visitors, thankfully they were awake when we broke in into their room! Room service was awful, our room was never clean and when we complaint the guy at the reception said he was very nervous and he was having a bad day.. The staff in general wasn't helpful at all and they could hardly speak english, we even lost our flight when we asked them to call a taxi for us and they misunderstood it! All in all this was a terrible hotel with unprofessional staff, avoid staying there even if you find a great deal and try your luck with other hotels located in the Latin Quarter, there are many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We never got to stay in this hotel as when we arrived (on 30th December 2003) we were told our room wasn't available due to technical problems. They had obviously overbooked and the lady on the Reception desk was very rude and unhelpful and really couldn't care less. She said we could have a room in another of the chain's hotels - it was miles away from where we wanted to be and when we got there is was a dreadful hotel and the room stunk of cigarettes. We phoned around lots of other hotels and thankfully found somewhere else to stay (and as it was New Year that was some task!) but Libertel never offered an apology or any compensation. I would certainly NEVER recommend the Libertel Quartier Latin or indeed any of their other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: E.Bachman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at this hotel. Other than the location (superb) and the lobby (charming), there is little to recommend it and we will not stay there again. Our room was claustrophobically small, as was the bathroom. The mattress was lumpy and the noise from the Rue des Ecoles was significant. For what we paid (about $170 a night), we expected higher quality.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok for the cost, but overall disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't quite in the "Latin Quarter"...it's a bit away from the main part of it. But it is near 2 metro stops and Notre Dame. The staff were mostly helpful and did handle a special request for me on room location. But when my fridge didn't work, 3 discussions with them did not fix the problem. The shower is roomy for Europe and runs fine but then turns scalding hot or icy cold...some days worse than others. The doors are not very "sealed" and noise in the hall (like maids vacuuming) will wake you up if you like to sleep in. Some rooms are roomy and fine like 501, but others like 504 are quite cramped. But they have a lift and there are some nice restaurants very nearby. Overall, I would stay there again, but not before searching out other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jaybea
Reviews.Content: Very close to Metro 'Cardinal Limone', small hotel, clean, avoid room on ground floor - very noisy. Small cramped breakfast room. Excellent range of restaurants and bars close by.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MargretUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: I didn't enjoy staying here. It felt like student accommodation - bed too low down, carpet tiles on the floor, custard-coloured walls. The strangest feature was the mini bar. Surely, the whole point of a bar is that it contains alcoholic drinks? This one didn't - plenty of water, orange juice and crisps but no alcohol. The lobby could have been nice, because it looks a bit like a small library, but you couldn't enjoy it in pleace because there was usually a member of staff sitting there, and the atmosphere was gloomy. You also had to buzz the door to get in during the evening. Quite a long walk to the nearest metro stop, too. On the plus side, it was clean and some might even call it quirky.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2004. We had room 401, which has two twin beds pushed together and a fold-out sofa bed. The room was large (compared to most Parisian hotels) and clean. We had a large bathroom with a tub and heated towel rack. The breakfast was great: juices, pastries, bread, jam, fresh cut fruit, yogurt, scrambled eggs. The staff was helpful and freindly. The location is excellent, near two metro stops and 5 minutes from Notre Dame. Lots of restaurants and food stands are right outside the front door. Our group also had rooms 303 and 603. Room 303 was smaller, but still adequate. The room overlooks a bar across the street, and it was noisy until about 1 am. Room 603 was smaller, but had a balcony. All rooms had large bathrooms with a tub, a minibar and a safe. The hotel has a tiny elevator. We would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Quartier Latin
HotelInfo.Address: 9 rue des Ecoles, 75005 Paris, France
